title: What are the average GED scores? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are four individual GED sub-tests (also referred to as modules). In most states, you have two years to deal with these four modules. The GED diploma is all across North America recognized and accepted just like a common high school diploma by colleges, universities, and employers. The tests are scored on a scale that’s going from 100 to 200. The passing score on each sub-test is 145, so your overall score must be at least 580. The four GED testing areas are Literacy (Reasoning through Language Arts), Math (Mathematical Reasoning), Science, and Social Studies. The GED performance levels are:Below Passing Score: 100-144High School Equivalency score: 145-164College Ready Score: 165-174College Ready + College Credit Score: 175-200 Students who score in the College Ready or College Ready Plus Credit range are generally not required to take the ACT or SAT.
